name: AllureGenerateTask
description: Generate an Allure Report export and view the output in Azure DevOps
author: Jayden Maalouf

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Configuration directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory containing the Allure report output. The default value is $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)

inputs.name: reportDirectory
inputs.label: Report directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory to push the generated Allure export to. The default value is $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/allure-report

inputs.name: outputDirectory
inputs.label: Output directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory to push the generated Allure HTML. The default value is $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/complete.html

inputs.name: publishResults
inputs.label: Publish Test Results
inputs.helpMarkDown: Publish Allure Test results to Azure DevOps

inputs.name: testResultsDirectory
inputs.label: Test Results directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory to publish the test results from. The default value is $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)

inputs.name: runTitle
inputs.label: Test Result Run Title
inputs.helpMarkDown: Used to seperate the results in the Test Results viewer. The default value is 'Allure Results'

inputs.name: resultFilesFilter
inputs.label: Result Files Filter
inputs.helpMarkDown: Used to filter the results files passed to the Publish Test Results. The default value is **/*.xml

inputs.name: testReporter
inputs.label: Unit Test Reporter
inputs.helpMarkDown: Which Test Reporter to use when publishing Tests to Azure DevOps. The default value is 'JUnit'
